questions.q: Which tag is used to define the start of an HTML table?
questions.explanation: Tables are defined with the <table> tag [1].

questions.q: In an HTML table, what does the 'td' in the <td> tag stand for?
questions.explanation: The letters td stand for 'table data,' which represents the content of a data cell [1].

questions.q: Which tag is used to define a table header, and what is its default styling?
questions.explanation: Table headings are defined using the <th> tag and are centered and bold by default [2].

questions.q: Which attribute defines the space between the table cell borders and the content within the cell?
questions.explanation: The cellpadding attribute represents the distance between cell borders and the content within a cell [3, 4].

questions.q: If you want a table cell to span across three columns, which attribute should you use?
questions.explanation: The colspan attribute is used to merge two or more columns into a single column [5, 6].

questions.q: What is the purpose of the <form> tag in HTML?
questions.explanation: HTML Forms are required when you want to collect some data from the site visitor, such as during user registration [7].
options: To create a table for data
To collect data from a site visitor
To style the background of a page
To link multiple web pages together

questions.q: Which attribute of the <form> tag specifies where the user input is sent for processing?
questions.explanation: The action attribute defines where the data is sent, such as a back-end file (e.g., test.php) [8, 9].

questions.q: What is a primary characteristic of the 'GET' method in form submission?
questions.explanation: The GET method appends form data to the URL, making it visible and subject to character limits [10].
options: It is the most secure way to send sensitive data.
It appends form data to the URL as name/value pairs.
It has no size limitations for data transfer.
The submitted data is hidden from the user.

questions.q: Which input type should be used if the user needs to enter a password so that the characters are masked?
questions.explanation: The type='password' attribute is used for fields where characters should not be visible [11, 12].

questions.q: Which attribute is used to display a short hint in an input field before the user enters a value?
questions.explanation: The placeholder attribute provides a hint or example text inside the input field [13].

questions.q: In a form, which tags are used together to create a group of related elements with a caption?
questions.explanation: A <fieldset> is used to group related elements, and a <legend> provides a caption for that group [14].

questions.q: To ensure that a user can only select one option from a list of several choices, which input type and requirement must be met?
questions.explanation: Radio buttons are used for selecting one option among many, and they must share the same name attribute to function as a group [15, 16].
options: type='checkbox'; all must have different names
type='radio'; all must have the same name attribute
type='select'; all must have different values
type='button'; all must have the same id

questions.q: Which tag is used to create a multi-line text input area in an HTML form?
questions.explanation: The <textarea> tag is used to create a multi-line text input field [17, 18].

questions.q: How can you make a checkbox or radio button selected by default when the page loads?
questions.explanation: The checked attribute is set if you want an input to be selected by default [16, 19].

questions.q: Which tag is used to define a drop-down list in an HTML form?
questions.explanation: The <select> tag is used to create a drop-down list, with <option> tags defining the items within it [20, 21].
